LockupDynamic.Segment[]","name":"segments","type":"tuple[]"},{"internalType":"uint40","name":"blockTimestamp","type":"uint40"},{"components":[{"internalType":"uint40","name":"start","type":"uint40"},{"internalType":"uint40","name":"end","type":"uint40"}],"internalType":"struct Lockup.Timestamps","name":"timestamps","type":"tuple"},{"internalType":"uint128","name":"withdrawnAmount","type":"uint128"}],"name":"calculateLockupDynamicStreamedAmount","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint128","name":"","type":"uint128"}],"stateMutability":"pure","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint128","name":"depositedAmount","type":"uint128"},{"internalType":"uint40","name":"blockTimestamp","type":"uint40"},{"components":[{"internalType":"uint40","name":"start","type":"uint40"},{"internalType":"uint40","name":"end","type":"uint40"}],"internalType":"struct Lockup.Timestamps","name":"timestamps","type":"tuple"},{"internalType":"uint40","name":"cliffTime","type":"uint40"},{"components":[{"internalType":"uint128","name":"start","type":"uint128"},{"internalType":"uint128","name":"cliff","type":"uint128"}],"internalType":"struct LockupLinear.UnlockAmounts","name":"unlockAmounts","type":"tuple"},{"internalType":"uint128","name":"withdrawnAmount","type":"uint128"}],"name":"calculateLockupLinearStreamedAmount","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint128","name":"","type":"uint128"}],"stateMutability":"pure","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint128","name":"depositedAmount","type":"uint128"},{"internalType":"uint40","name":"blockTimestamp","type":"uint40"},{"components":[{"internalType":"uint40","name":"start","type":"uint40"},{"internalType":"uint40","name":"end","type":"uint40"}],"internalType":"struct Lockup.Timestamps","name":"timestamps","type":"tuple"},{"components":[{"internalType":"uint128","name":"amount","type":"uint128"},{"internalType":"uint40","name":"timestamp","type":"uint40"}],"internalType":"struct LockupTranched.Tranche[]","name":"tranches","type":"tuple[]"}],"name":"calculateLockupTranchedStreamedAmount","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint128","name":"","type":"uint128"}],"stateMutability":"pure","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"kind":"dev","methods":{"calculateLockupDynamicStreamedAmount(uint128,LockupDynamic.Segment[],uint40,Lockup.Timestamps,uint128)":{"details":"Lockup dynamic model uses the following distribution function: $$ f(x) = x^{exp} * csa + \\Sigma(esa) $$ Where: - $x$ is the elapsed time divided by the total duration of the current segment. - $exp$ is the current segment exponent. - $csa$ is the current segment amount. - $\\Sigma(esa)$ is the sum of all vested segments' amounts. Notes: 1. Normalization to 18 decimals is not needed because there is no mix of amounts with different decimals. 2. The stream's start time must be in the past so that the calculations below do not overflow. 3. The stream's end time must be in the future so that the loop below does not panic with an \"index out of bounds\" error. Assumptions: 1. The sum of all segment amounts does not overflow uint128 and equals the deposited amount. 2. The first segment's timestamp is greater than the start time. 3. The last segment's timestamp equals the end time. 4. The segment timestamps are arranged in ascending order."},"calculateLockupLinearStreamedAmount(uint128,uint40,Lockup.Timestamps,uint40,LockupLinear.UnlockAmounts,uint128)":{"details":"Lockup linear model uses the following distribution function: $$        ( x * sa + s, block timestamp < cliff time f(x) = (        ( x * sa + s + c, block timestamp => cliff time $$ Where: - $x$ is the elapsed time in the streamable range divided by the total streamable range. - $sa$ is the streamable amount, i.e. deposited amount minus unlock amounts' sum. - $s$ is the start unlock amount. - $c$ is the cliff unlock amount. Assumptions: 1. The sum of the unlock amounts (start and cliff) does not overflow uint128 and is less than or equal to the deposit amount. 2. The start time is before the end time. 3. If the cliff time is not zero, it is after the start time and before the end time."},"calculateLockupTranchedStreamedAmount(uint128,uint40,Lockup.Timestamps,LockupTranched.Tranche[])":{"details":"Lockup tranched model uses the following distribution function: $$ f(x) = \\Sigma(eta) $$ Where: - $\\Sigma(eta)$ is the sum of all vested tranches' amounts. Assumptions: 1. The sum of all tranche amounts does not overflow uint128, and equals the deposited amount. 2. The first tranche's timestamp is greater than the start time. 3. The last tranche's timestamp equals the end time. 4. The tranche timestamps are arranged in ascending order."}},"title":"VestingMath","version":1},"userdoc":{"errors":{"PRBMath_MulDiv18_Overflow(uint256,uint256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when the resultant value in {mulDiv18} overflows uint256."}],"PRBMath_MulDiv_Overflow(uint256,uint256,uint256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when the resultant value in {mulDiv} overflows uint256."}],"PRBMath_SD59x18_Div_InputTooSmall()":[{"notice":"Thrown when dividing two numbers and one of them is `MIN_SD59x18`."}],"PRBMath_SD59x18_Div_Overflow(int256,int256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when dividing two numbers and one of the intermediary unsigned results overflows SD59x18."}],"PRBMath_SD59x18_Exp2_InputTooBig(int256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when taking the binary exponent of a base greater than 192e18."}],"PRBMath_SD59x18_IntoUint256_Underflow(int256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when trying to cast an SD59x18 number that doesn't fit in uint256."}],"PRBMath_SD59x18_Log_InputTooSmall(int256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when taking the logarithm of a number less than or equal to zero."}],"PRBMath_SD59x18_Mul_InputTooSmall()":[{"notice":"Thrown when multiplying two numbers and one of the inputs is `MIN_SD59x18`."}],"PRBMath_SD59x18_Mul_Overflow(int256,int256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when multiplying two numbers and the intermediary absolute result overflows SD59x18."}],"PRBMath_UD60x18_IntoUint128_Overflow(uint256)":[{"notice":"Thrown when trying to cast a UD60x18 number that doesn't fit in uint128."}]},"kind":"user","methods":{"calculateLockupDynamicStreamedAmount(uint128,LockupDynamic.Segment[],uint40,Lockup.Timestamps,uint128)":{"notice":"Calculates the streamed amount for a Lockup dynamic stream."},"calculateLockupLinearStreamedAmount(uint128,uint40,Lockup.Timestamps,uint40,LockupLinear.UnlockAmounts,uint128)":{"notice":"Calculates the streamed amount for a Lockup linear stream."},"calculateLockupTranchedStreamedAmount(uint128,uint40,Lockup.Timestamps,LockupTranched.Tranche[])":{"notice":"Calculates the streamed amount for a Lockup tranched stream."}},"notice":"Library with functions needed to calculate vested amount across lockup calculateLockupDynamicStreamedAmount(uin.details: Lockup dynamic model uses the following distribution function: $$ f(x) = x^{exp} * csa + \Sigma(esa) $$ Where: - $x$ is the elapsed time divided by the total duration of the current segment. - $exp$ is the current segment exponent. - $csa$ is the current segment amount. - $\Sigma(esa)$ is the sum of all vested segments' amounts. Notes: 1. Normalization to 18 decimals is not needed because there is no mix of amounts with different decimals. 2. The stream's start time must be in the past so that the calculations below do not overflow. 3. The stream's end time must be in the future so that the loop below does not panic with an "index out of bounds" error. Assumptions: 1. The sum of all segment amounts does not overflow uint128 and equals the deposited amount. 2. The first segment's timestamp is greater than the start time. 3. The last segment's timestamp equals the end time. 4. The segment timestamps are arranged in ascending order.

calculateLockupLinearStreamedAmount(uint.details: Lockup linear model uses the following distribution function: $$        ( x * sa + s, block timestamp < cliff time f(x) = (        ( x * sa + s + c, block timestamp => cliff time $$ Where: - $x$ is the elapsed time in the streamable range divided by the total streamable range. - $sa$ is the streamable amount, i.e. deposited amount minus unlock amounts' sum. - $s$ is the start unlock amount. - $c$ is the cliff unlock amount. Assumptions: 1. The sum of the unlock amounts (start and cliff) does not overflow uint128 and is less than or equal to the deposit amount. 2. The start time is before the end time. 3. If the cliff time is not zero, it is after the start time and before the end time.

calculateLockupTranchedStreamedAmount(ui.details: Lockup tranched model uses the following distribution function: $$ f(x) = \Sigma(eta) $$ Where: - $\Sigma(eta)$ is the sum of all vested tranches' amounts. Assumptions: 1. The sum of all tranche amounts does not overflow uint128, and equals the deposited amount. 2. The first tranche's timestamp is greater than the start time. 3. The last tranche's timestamp equals the end time. 4. The tranche timestamps are arranged in ascending order.

calculateLockupDynamicStreamedAmount(uin.notice: Calculates the streamed amount for a Lockup dynamic stream.

calculateLockupLinearStreamedAmount(uint.notice: Calculates the streamed amount for a Lockup linear stream.

calculateLockupTranchedStreamedAmount(ui.notice: Calculates the streamed amount for a Lockup tranched stream.
